intro: Tournefortia difformis, commonly known as the variable tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually opposite, simple, and have a rough texture. Tournefortia difformis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
